page.title: 08STREAM PATH TO N..CAVE MILL
page.content: My favourite walk is by the church just across from my house. The walk (ref.898328) takes you just past a stream by an old mill and up through two lines of bushes right onto the footpath of Church Street, North Cave. Things to look out for on the walk are fishes with red spots on their backs. Before I reach the mill pond and the site of the water wheel there is a special tree shaped like a chair. This is where the mill race separates from the main stream. A good idea is to rest in the "chair" if you are tired of walking and just watch the sandy-bedded stream and the water running by. Sometimes, after rain, I see the occasional frog wallowing in the wet mud.
